result.execSummary:
The defendant Patsy K. Thornburgh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property (>$2500-$5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bf).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay $1,000.00 fine plus costs on EACH count.    Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

Pay $1,000.00 fine plus costs on EACH count.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) years. 10:06 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Patsy K. Thornburgh in court with Atty James B. Duquette.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing after defendant was found guilty after a jury trial.  Court makes record as to charges, penalties and restitution.  Court has reviewed victim impact statements.  Court has read the character letters that there submitted.  
10:08 am  Statement by Jacqueline Leedle on behalf of defendant.  
10:10 am  Statement by Dennis Wisniewski on behalf of defendant.  
10:11 am  Statement by Dale Vavra on behalf of defendant.  
10:13 am  Statement by Pat Alvarez on behalf of defendant.  
10:14 am  Statement by Nancy Douglass, victim.  
10:16 am  Restitution has been paid to Atty Duquette's office.  Atty Duquette has a trust check for the amount of the restitution which he gives to the victims.  
10:17 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Johnson.  
10:23 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Duquette.  
10:37 am  Ms. Thornburgh does not wish to make a statement.  
10:38 am  Court makes record and sentences defendant.  

SENTENCE:
$1,000 Fine plus costs on EACH Count;
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge on each count; 
Deft must either pay fine & costs in 30 days or set up a payment plan within next 30 days.  

10:48 am  Court in recess.

8:44 am  Case called. Appearances made. 
Defendant Patsy K. Thornburgh in court with Attorney James B. Duquette. Prosecuting Attorney Haley Jo Johnson appeared for State of Wisconsin with court officer Detective William Borgen in court. 
Parties agree that there are no Miranda Goodchild issues here. 
Court has colloquy with defendant on her right to testify. 
Court finds that defendant has freely, knowingly and willingly deciding to testify. 
Attorney Johnson states full offer on the record as rejected by defendant.
Court addresses parties on victims being present in court during trial. 
Attorney Duquette objects and makes argument. 
Court finds that both victims can be present in court room, all other witnesses are not able to be present in court room. 
8:57 am Court in recess. 
Court is off the record and in the jury assembly room. Clerk Kristina Secord takes attendance and gives Oath to Jurors in jury assembly room. 
9:37 am Court back on the record. Jurors are seated in the court room and 24 jurors are seated in the jury box. 
9:38 am Charges read. Attorney's introduce themselves, other members of their office.  Court reads witnesses names and the names that may be referenced. Court explains process of voir dire to jurors.

11:51 am Court in recess. Court reminds attorneys of witnesses being sequestered.

records.addlTxt: Jury trial - 12 person on January 3, 2018 at 08:00 am.

2:30 pm FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Patsy K. Thornburgh in court with Atty James B. Duquette.  
Court advises parties that this case is the #3 case for trial on July 24th.  
Court is leaving this on the trial calendar until after the 1:15 Call on July 20th.  
If all other cases ahead of this get resolved, then Ms. Thornburgh's case will proceed to trial.  
Court will then conduct a Final pre-trial on Friday, July 21st at 2:00 pm.  
The State filed a letter requesting the Court to reconsider its ruling excluding Ms. Nancy Douglass from courtroom during trial.  
Court will address this at time of final pre-trial if this case is going to proceed to trial  
Final pre-trial scheduled for July 21, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Letter Brief

2:30 pm FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  Case called at 3:28 pm
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Patsy K. Thornburgh in court with attorney James B. Duquette.  
Matter is before the Court for a FPT.  This has been set for Trial on multiple occasions.  Court notes this is the #1 case for trial on Monday.  Just before lunch the Court received a copy of the defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  Argument by Atty Duquette as to the Motion to Dismiss.  A key witness, Officer Domino, was served with a subpoena and is refusing to appear for trial.   8:34 am  Response by Atty Johnson.  3:37 pm  Response by Atty Duquette.  3:38 pm  Court makes record.  Court will not grant Motion to Dismiss but will not force the defense to go to trial on Monday.  Court will also not force the State to get the witness back up here for trial on Monday.  Court gives defense the choice as to whether or not they wish to proceed to trial on Monday, or do they want the Court to reset this.  3:42 pm  Court takes brief recess to allow Atty Duquette to discuss it with his client.  3:50 pm  Court in session.  Atty Duquette requests that the JT be adjourned to a new date.  
Final pre-trial scheduled for July 5, 2017 at 02:30 pm.  
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for July 24, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Final pre-trial on April 6, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on April 10, 2017 at 08:30 am.
02-02-2017 - E-mail from Atty Duquette, re:  whether deft has any objection to case being tried before Judge Koss on 02/06/2017

2:30 PM FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  
3:22 PM  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  ADA Haley Johnson appears for the State.  Atty James Duquette is appearing with defendant who is present in court.  Case is set for Jury Trial on Monday.  This is the #1 case for trial.  Both sides are prepared to proceed to trial.  Court will seat 23 jurors in the box for voir dire.  Each side will get 5 strikes.  Motions in Limine:  Atty Duquette is just asking for the standard motions in limine that he believes the parties can sort out.  Court will order exclusion of witnesses.  They can be present for voir dire so that they can be introduced to the jurors.  After voir dire, the witnesses would have to step out of the Courtroom.  State's court officer can remain in courtroom.  Discussion with regard to victims remaining in the courtroom during the trial.  Atty Duquette makes argument that the vehicles were never titled to the victims named by the State.  Court makes record and will allow the Douglas' to be present in courtroom during trial as persons against whom a crime has been committed.  Atty Duquette argues that Nancy Douglas is not a victim and should not be present in courtroom during trial.  3:32 pm  Response by Atty Johnson that the victims had personal property on the vehicles that was not recovered.  Atty Duquette notes that is not what is charged here.  Court will allow Mr. Douglas to be present during the trial but will apply the sequestration / exclusion rule to Mrs. Douglas during the trial.  State will provide information on Monday as to any convictions any of the witnesses may have.  State to file Jury Instructions with the Court by Friday at noon.  Both Attys agree to allow the jurors to ask questions at the end of each witness' testimony.  Attorneys stipulate that the video that may be played for the jury speaks for itself and the court reporter would not need to transcribed.  3:39 pm  Court in recess.
Defendant's Second Demand for Discovery and Inspection

8:31 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Patsy K. Thornburgh in court with Atty James B. Duquette.  
Matter is before the Court for hearing on Motion filed by the State - a Motion to Amend the Information.  
Court has reviewed the Motion and the Brief.  
8:32 am  Response by Atty Duquette noting this Motion is being filed long after this case was filed.  He agrees that he can't argue that there is surprise or prejudice.  
8:33 am  Response by Atty Johnson.  
8:35 am  Court makes record and grants State's Motion to Amend the Information.  State will file an Amended Information this week.  
8:36 am  Atty Duquette files a 2nd Discovery Demand with regard to text messages of investigating officer.  
8:38 am  Atty Johnson can look into whether the text messages exist and can respond to Atty Duquette.  Court asks that if Atty Johnson objects that she has the obligation to obtain and provide the text messages, the Court would want the objection in writing before the end of the year so that it can be calendared for hearing.  
8:39 am  Court in recess.
Brief in Support of State's Motion to Amend Information
Motion to Amend Information

Final pre-trial on February 1, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on February 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Response to State's Demand for Discovery

Defendant Patsy K. Thornburgh in court with attorney James B. Duquette.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session. Matter before the Court for final pre-trial for trial set for October 10th and 11th. Atty. Duquette makes a record that they will confirm for trial at this time, but a new offer has been made with reduced charges. However, he just received the amended charges prior to Court and needs time to go over new charges/penalties, and new offer with his client. Court leaves trial on as scheduled, but will allow parties to accept agreement as long as matter is put on for plea and sentencing no later than Thursday, October 6, 2016 @ 1:15 p.m. If no agreement, parties will address any motions in limine on the morning of trial.

2:30 PM FINAL PRETRIAL CALENDAR:  Atty Daniel Necci appeared on behalf of the State; Defendant was present in person and by Atty James Duquette.  State had 2 witnesses not available for the Monday jury trial date.  This case ended up being bumped from the trial calendar by another case being tried on these same dates.  New FPT and JT dates have been scheduled.  FPT on 09/28/2016 at 2:30 pm: JURY TRIAL on October 10 and 11, 2016 at 8:30 am;  These dates are before Judge Drettwan.
